intro: Sutera tenuicaulis, commonly known as slender-stemmed sutera, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia, particularly China and India. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories or along stream banks. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a rough texture, while its flowers are usually pale blue or white. Sutera tenuicaulis is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
